title: (x) "Feel better, Tylenol" sans - H&FJ Gotham, (similar to) Optima {Mike D, Florian}
content:
Does anyone know what font is used in the current ’Feel better, Tylenol’ ad campaign? You can see this font [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000222/http:/www.tylenol.com/), used in the ’Feel better’ above the Tylenol logo.

Thx!
author: meanjean

comments.content:
Its Gotham from Hoefler and Frere Jones.

At first it looked like something else because of the distortion from Flash, but when you zoom in you see it all very clearly.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000222im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gotham_5908.png)

Mikey :-)
Does anyone know what font is used for the tylenol Logo itself?
Could have started out as [Optima Black Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507000222/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/optima_std_extra_black_italic/?sample_text=TYLENOL).
